question: 3) Which of the following IoT networks has a very short range?
explanation: Description: Short-range wireless networks have a very short range. This type of network is used for applications running in the local environment. The best example of this network is Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.

question: 4) What is the full form of the LPWAN?
explanation: Description: The full form of the LPWAN is Low Power Wide Area Network. LPWAN is a type of wireless telecommunication, and it is specially designed for M2M (Machine to Machine) and IoT devices.

question: 5) An IoT network is a collection of ______ devices.
explanation: Description: An IoT network is a collection of interconnected devices that communicate with other devices without human involvement.

question: 6) Which one of the following is not an IoT device?
explanation: Description: These are all IoT devices. Google Home is a smart speaker that obeys all the commands given by the user. The Amazon Echo Voice Controller is also a smart speaker. The Nest Smoke Alarm is an IoT device that sends a smoke alert message to the user when a fire occurs.

question: 7) What is the main purpose of WoT (Web of Things) in the IoT?
explanation: Description: The main purpose of the Web of Things is to improve the usability and interoperability in IoT. Developing IoT Apps through WoT is much easier, faster, and less expensive.

question: 8) What is the Arduino UNO?
explanation: Description: The Arduino Uno is a hardware device that is based on the Microchip ATmega328P microcontroller. It has been developed by Arduino.cc.

question: 12) What is the role of Big Data in IoT's Smart Grid architecture?
explanation: Description: The main role of Big Data is to store data on a real-time basis. It uses multiple storage technologies to store the data.

question: 13) What is the real example of a smart grid device in IoT?
explanation: Description: Smart Grid is used to monitor the power supply. Consumers' data is collected using a smart grid, and that data is analyzed and distributed to the consumers. The real example of a smart grid device is a smart meter.

question: 15) What is the full form of ICT?
explanation: Description: The full form of ICT is Information and Communication Technology. ICT is a multidimensional term for the IT sector that refers to all communication technologies, including the Internet, wireless networks, cell phones, computers, and software.

question: 16) Which of the following frequencies is correct for the Galileo gen 2 board?
explanation: Description: The frequency of this board is 400 MHz. The Galileo gen 2 board frequency gives the speed of operation of the board. Therefore, the speed increases as the frequency increases.

question: 17) What is the full form of IANA?
explanation: Description: The full form of IANA is Internet-Assigned-Numbers-Authority. It is an administrative function of the Internet that monitors the IP addresses and domain names.

question: 18) What is the standard port number of secure MQTT?
explanation: Description: The standard port number of Secure MQTT is 8883, and it is registered in IANA for Secure MQTT.

question: 19) Which of the following layers provides end-to-end communication in IoT?
explanation: Description: The transport layer focuses on end-to-end communication, and it gives reliability and congestion avoidance that packets will be delivered in the same way as the user sent the packet.

question: 20) Which of the following devices is used to measure the gases or liquid?
explanation: Description: The pressure sensor is used to measure the gases or liquid. Pressure is the expression of a force that is necessary to prevent fluid from expansion.

question: 21) Which interface does the fingerprint sensor use?
explanation: Description: The fingerprint sensor uses a UART interface to store fingerprint data. It can be configured in 1:1 or 1:N mode to identify the person.

question: 22) Which of the following protocols is used by USART?
explanation: Description: The most commonly used protocol for USART in asynchronous mode is RS232C. This protocol describes the physical interface for relatively low-speed serial data-communication between devices and computers.

question: 23) What is the full form of HDLC?
explanation: Description: The full form of the HDLC is High level Data Link Control. It is a communication protocol. It is used to transmit data between nodes and data points.

question: 24) Which of the following "bit" defines the address bit in the control register?
explanation: Description: The MM bit defines the address bit in the control register.

question: 25) What is another name for I2C?
explanation: Description: The I2C protocol is also known as the two-wire interface. It is a simple serial-communication-protocol that uses pins of a microcontroller, named as serial clock (SCL) and serial data (SDA).

question: 26) When the clock line SCL is high, the SDA is ____ transitioned.
explanation: Description: When the clock line SCL is high, the SDA is low transitioned. Under normal circumstances, this does not happen, as you can see in the subsequent clock pulses that the data line is stable in one state, either high or low, when the clock line is high.

question: 27) Which of the following protocols does the secure digital card application use?
explanation: Description: SPI stands for Serial Peripheral Interface. The SPI protocol is commonly used to secure digital card applications and liquid crystal displays.

question: 28) How many logic signals are there in the SPI protocol?
explanation: Description: There are five logic signals in the SPI protocol.

question: 29) What does MOSI mean?
options: MOSI is a clock signal that sends the clock signals from master to slave.
MOSI is a data line that sends the data from master to slave.
answer: MOSI is a data line that sends the data from master to slave.

question: 30) What is the full form of HART?
explanation: Description: The full form of HART is Highway Addressable Remote Transducer. It is a master and slave protocol in which a slave device only speaks when spoken by a master.

question: 31) What is the range of z-wave?

question: 32) Which of the following topology is used for ZigBee Smart Energy?
